thread.title: Deadpool's Ryan Reynolds Shares Photo From The Golden Globes
thread.title_full: Deadpool's Ryan Reynolds Shares Photo From The Golden Globes

author: Jamie Lovett
title: Deadpool's Ryan Reynolds Shares Photo From The Golden Globes

organizations.name: ryan reynolds asked fans for deadpool

text:
Deadpool's Ryan Reynolds Shares Photo From The Golden Globes Jamie Lovett A photo posted by @amyschumer on Jan 7, 2017 at 5:32pm PST 
Reynolds has responded in kind, sharing a photo of himself enjoying a stirring conversation with the seat markers for Schumer and Goldie Hawn. A photo posted by Ryan Reynolds (@vancityreynolds) on Jan 7, 2017 at 5:52pm PST 
Deadpool and Reynolds are considered underdogs to win at the Golden Globe Awards, but the actor seems to be enjoying the event either way. 
MORE: Ryan Reynolds Discusses Deadpool’s Pansexuality / Early Deadpool Concept Art / Ryan Reynolds Clarifies Rumors About Deadpool Starring In Logan / John Wick Director To Helm Deadpool 2 / Fox and Marvel Swapped Deadpool And Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2 Characters / Deadpool 2 Will NOT Start Filming In Early 2017 / Ryan Reynolds Asked Fans For Deadpool 2 Input / Reynolds, Miller Clashed Over Cable Casting / Rumored Further Details On Tim Miller's Deadpool 2 Departure 
Based upon Marvel Comics’ most unconventional anti-hero, DEADPOOL tells the origin story of former Special Forces operative turned mercenary Wade Wilson, who after being subjected to a rogue experiment that leaves him with accelerated healing powers, adopts the alter ego Deadpool. Armed with his new abilities and a dark, twisted sense of humor, Deadpool hunts down the man who nearly destroyed his life. 
Deadpool is directed by Tim Miller and written by Rhett Reese and Paul Wernick. Deadpool stars Ryan Reynolds, Morena Baccarin, Ed Skrein, T.J. Miller, Gina Carano, Leslie Uggams, Brianna Hildebrand and Stefan Kapičić. Deadpool 2016 ComicBook Composite 83.21 #5 All-Time Comic Movies Average rating
